headline: Karur Vysya Bank stock jumps 12% to record high after strong Q3 numbers
condensed_text: Shares of Karur Vysya Bank gained 12% in Tuesday's session, January 27, to reach a fresh all-time high of ₹ 298 apiece, as investors appeared to be pleased with the company's December quarter performance. In the same period last year, the bank had reported a net profit of ₹ 496 crore, and in the September quarter it came in at ₹ 574 crore, according to bank's earnings' report. Net interest income (NII), which represents the difference between the interest earned from loans and the interest paid to depositors, stood at ₹ 1,239 crore in Q3, up from ₹ 1,081 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. On the asset quality front, the bank’s gross non-performing assets (NPAs) declined by 12 basis points year-on-year to 0.71%, while net NPAs fell marginally by one basis point year-on-year to 0.19%. In terms of advances, the RAM Verticals, which include Retail, Personal Banking, Agriculture, and Commercial, recorded a notable increase of ₹ 13,383 crore, rising from ₹ 70,005 crore to ₹ 83,388 crore, marking a 19% year-on-year growth, according to the bank’s earnings report.

headline: Sula Vineyards, Radico Khaitan, United Spirits fall up to 4% as European wines bag cuts from India-EU trade deal
condensed_text: Shares of Sula Vineyards , Radico Khatain, United Spirits , United Breweries , and Globus Spirits tumbled up to 4% as European wines are set to enter the Indian market at lower prices under the bilateral free trade agreement as India will provide import duty concessions under the pact, PTI reported, citing an official. Radico Khaitan shares declined 3% to Rs 2,877 per share, while United Spirits shares slipped as much as 2.5% to Rs 1,300 per share on the BSE. Under the agreement, India will extend duty concessions to wines from the European Union, broadly in line with the commitments made under its trade agreements with Australia and New Zealand, though with slightly lower thresholds. In the alcoholic beverages segment, India’s exports to the EU include wines worth $1.4 million in 2024–25 and blended whiskies, vodka, brandy and liqueurs valued at $24.5 million. Imports from the EU include wines worth $7.9 million, along with blended whiskies, brandy, gin, tequila, vodka and liqueurs amounting to $87.8 million.

headline: Japan's Nikkei rises as yen weakens, chip-related shares advance
condensed_text: The Nikkei rose 0.85% to close at 53,333.54, while the broader Topix ended 0.31% higher at 3,563.59. The market was cautious ‌earlier in the ‌session with all eyes on the yen that had spiked against the U.S. dollar on ‌Friday and climbed to a more than two-month high overnight. "The current level of the yen is negative for exporters, but positive for the election campaign," said ‍Hiroyuki Ueno, chief strategist at Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Asset Management. Japanese political parties kicked off an election campaign on Tuesday ‍after Prime ⁠Minister Sanae Takaichi called ⁠for a national election on February 8. Tokyo Electric Power fell 7.925% to become the worst percentage loser on the Nikkei after the utility firm announced plans to cut about 3.1 trillion yen ($20 billion) in costs over 10 years.

headline: JSW Energy on track for 15 GW capacity by FY26-end, plans ₹10,000 crore fundraise if needed
condensed_text: Mahendra said fresh capacity additions over the coming years are aligned with power purchase agreements already signed.“We are well on track to execute the further capacities,” he said.Mahendra added that JSW Energy had free cash of more than ₹7,000 crore at the end of the third quarter, providing a cushion to continue with its capital expenditure programme. The company has also taken approval from shareholders and its board to raise up to ₹10,000 crore, if required, to ensure the timely commissioning of projects.JSW Energy reported a net profit of ₹420 crore for the October-December 2025 quarter of fiscal year 2025-26 , compared with ₹168 crore a year earlier, marking a 2.5-fold increase, driven by higher power generation and contributions from recently acquired assets.The company currently has a market capitalisation of ₹75,372.51 crore. There, we have realised, as compared to the merchant price average of ₹3.22, our realisations have been almost 20% higher, and that is because of the strategic short-term tie-ups, which we have done with some of the distribution companies  and states that need power at this point.So that is a proactive approach we have been taking historically, and we continue to do that. Regarding the capital requirement, the funding, you can see that at quarter three end, we have shown in our books that we have free cash of almost in excess of ₹7,000 crore, which gives us a big cushion to continue with our capex plan.But as and when required, we have taken the enabling approval from the shareholders as well as the board for raising capital up to ₹10,000 crore, as and when required, to ensure that our timely commissioning of the capacities is there, and funding is not a constraint for us.Also Read | Sona BLW CEO says Europe capex push and supplier stress could benefit Indian auto firmsQ: Funding is not a constraint. This is also one of the options for which we went to the shareholders through the EGM and took the approval for promoter equity infusion.And promoter equity, if we see the way it is in general, what we are witnessing in terms of how the markets are performing, because of a lot of global geopolitical reasons and reasons beyond control, to the sector, to the industry, to the country, or maybe to any individual industry player.

headline: Axis Bank evaluating acquisition of promoter stake in CreditAccess Grameen: Sources to CNBC-TV18
condensed_text: Axis Bank is evaluating the acquisition of the promoter stake in microfinance lender CreditAccess Grameen and may place a bid, sources told CNBC-TV18.According to sources, the promoters of CreditAccess Grameen have initiated a process to sell their entire stake in the company. Promoter entity CreditAccess India BV currently holds a 66.28% stake in CreditAccess Grameen.Sources further indicate that CreditAccess Grameen has likely appointed bankers to run the stake sale process. The company is understood to have mandated one foreign investment bank and one Indian investment bank for the transaction.The value of the promoter stake is estimated at approximately ₹14,000 crore, and the market capitalisation is approximately ₹22,000 crore. The company is understood to have mandated one foreign investment bank and one Indian investment bank for the transaction.Axis Bank is among the potential bidders evaluating the opportunity, though no final decision has been taken at this stage, sources added.CreditAccess Grameen is one of the leading microfinance institutions in the country, with a strong presence across rural and semi-urban markets. As of the latest data, its assets under management  stand at approximately ₹26,000 crore.CNBC-TV18 has written to CreditAccess Grameen and Axis Bank seeking comments.

headline: Alembic Pharma receives final US FDA approval for eye inflammation drug
condensed_text: Alembic Pharma receives final US FDA approval for eye inflammation drug. Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd on Wednesday said it has received final approval from the US Food and Drug Administration  for its Abbreviated New Drug Application  for Difluprednate Ophthalmic Emulsion, 0.05%.The approved ANDA is therapeutically equivalent to the reference listed drug, Durezol Ophthalmic Emulsion, 0.05%, marketed by Sandoz Inc. Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion is used for the treatment of inflammation and pain associated with ocular surgery and is also indicated for the treatment of endogenous anterior uveitis.Alembic said the approval adds to its growing US generics portfolio. With this clearance, the company now has a cumulative total of 233 ANDA approvals from the US FDA, comprising 213 final approvals and 20 tentative approvals.Also Read: Alembic Pharma gets USFDA tentative approval for cancer treatment drugFollowing the announcement, shares of Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd recovered from an intraday low of ₹744.75 but continued to trade lower. As of 2:22 pm, the stock was down 0.58% at ₹760.10 on the NSE.

headline: HPCL, Castrol India team up to develop re-refined base oil ecosystem in India
condensed_text: HPCL, Castrol India team up to develop re-refined base oil ecosystem in India. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd  and Castrol India have signed a Memorandum of Understanding  to explore the development of a re-refined base oil  ecosystem in India, the companies said on Tuesday, January 27. The partnership will evaluate a circular model for collecting used lubricating oil and re-refining it for reuse in lubricant manufacturing as India looks to improve waste management and reduce reliance on virgin base oils.Under the agreement, the two companies will assess the commercial, operational and technical feasibility of scaling such a model, including mapping used oil collection channels, reviewing re-refining capacity and testing RRBO across lubricant formulations.“As energy markets transition, circularity in value chains will become increasingly important,” said Ch Srinivas, Executive Director for Lubes at HPCL. He further said that the initiative aims to recover material value while promoting responsible resource use.Castrol India’s interim CEO Saugata Basuray said used oil could be a valuable resource if processed correctly and that the collaboration could help reduce waste and environmental impact.Castrol India, in a regulatory exchange, highlighted that India generates large volumes of used lubricating oil annually with much of it either under-collected or disposed of through informal channels. International studies show that re-refining used oil can recover up to 70–80% of it as high-quality base oil while consuming significantly less energy than refining crude-based alternatives, the company said, adding that assessment work will begin immediately, with findings expected to guide the next phase of the initiative.Shares of Castrol India is trading at ₹183.90 apiece on the BSE, which is 0.08% higher than the day's opening.Also Read: Raymond Lifestyle Q3 Results: Stock surges nearly 6% after strong operational performance

headline: India-EU trade deal: OneSource Specialty, Syngene, Sigachi, other pharma stocks tank up to 19%; here's why
condensed_text:
India-EU trade deal: OneSource Specialty, Syngene, Sigachi, other pharma stocks tank up to 19%; here's why. Pharma shares fell in the afternoon session on Tuesday after India and the European Union inked a landmark trade agreement under which the duties of up to 11 per cent on EU pharma products will be nearly eliminated. FULL COVERAGE: Union Budget 2026
However, the easier access to input materials for the pharma sector from EU would also lead to a rise in competition for the Indian raw material firms. On BSE, OneSource Specialty Pharma (19%), Syngene International (11%), Sigachi Industries (10.41%), Wanbury Ltd (7%), Kwality Pharmaceuticals (5.67%), Supriya Lifescience (6%) and Suven Life Sciences (5.62%) were among the top losers in the afternoon session today. The pact is likely to significantly improve economic ties between the two sides, creating new opportunities for businesses while reshaping price dynamics for Indian consumers and industries.

headline: Tilaknagar Industries reshuffles top finance leadership
condensed_text: Tilaknagar Industries  announced a major reshuffle in its finance and audit leadership, appointing Rajesh Choudhary as Chief Financial Officer while moving current CFO Abhinav Gupta to head internal audit operations. Choudhary, who previously served as Senior Vice-President for Finance & Accounts, will now oversee the company’s financial strategy, planning and governance. Choudhary brings 29 years of experience, including 22 years in the alcohol beverage industry, primarily with Pernod Ricard India. The company also announced several redesignations: Minuzeer Bamboat adds Head-Legal to his Company Secretary role, Ameya Deshpande becomes Chief Strategy Officer, Nishant Jain is now Chief Sales Officer, Tarun Behl takes on manufacturing and projects responsibilities, and Sai Amrutkumar Vegisetti joins senior management as Chief Information Officer. Tilaknagar Industries recently acquired Imperial Blue Whisky from Pernod Ricard, with the brand achieving primary sales of 1.79 million cases in December 2025, its first month under new ownership.

headline: Asian Paints shares tumble 5% after Q3 PAT falls 5% YoY

The paint maker’s profit before depreciation, interest, tax, other income and exceptional items (PBDIT) increased by 8.8% to Rs 1,781 crore from Rs 1,637 crore in the corresponding quarter of the last financial year. Live Events Segment highlights International business: Net sales increased in Q3 FY26 by 6.3% to Rs 870 crore from Rs 818 crore, led by units in Sri Lanka, the UAE and Ethiopia. Profit before exceptional items and tax in Q3 FY26 came in at Rs 0.2 crore against a loss of Rs 7.4 crore in the corresponding period of the previous year. White Teak and Weatherseal: Net sales at White Teak in Q3 FY26 increased by 12.4% to Rs 29 crore, while Weatherseal rose by 58.6% to Rs 18.7 crore.

headline: Hindalco Industries to invest ₹21,000 crore in Odisha smelter expansion
condensed_text: Aluminium producer Hindalco Industries Ltd on Tuesday  announced a major expansion of its aluminium operations in Odisha, outlining a ₹21,000-crore smelter expansion and commissioning new downstream facilities as part of its ongoing growth capital expenditure programme.The company flagged a ₹21,000-crore, 3.6 lakh-tonne-per-annum smelter expansion at its Aditya Aluminium complex in Sambalpur. The battery-grade aluminium foil facility, India’s first, draws input directly from the FRP complex and is designed to support up to 100 GWh of lithium-ion cell manufacturing capacity, supporting the electric mobility and energy storage ecosystem.Also Read: Hindalco Industries shares fall 3% after reports of another fire at Novelis' Oswego plantThese projects form part of Hindalco’s broader growth capital expenditure programme, with around ₹37,000 crore planned for Odisha across upstream and downstream aluminium operations. The company is India’s largest flat rolled products player, accounting for more than 50% of the domestic market.With nearly 40% of flat-rolled aluminium currently imported into the country, the expanded FRP capacity is expected to cut import dependence by almost half, supporting domestic manufacturing and enhancing competitiveness in high-grade aluminium products.The smelter expansion at the Aditya Aluminium complex is also aligned with energy transition objectives. A portion of the power requirement for the expanded capacity is planned to be met through round-the-clock renewable energy, integrating sustainability considerations into large-scale industrial growth.Also Read: Hindalco shares slump 7% after Novelis results lead to multiple downgrades, target cutsHindalco said the projects are expected to generate over 15,000 additional jobs and support sectors such as electric vehicles, defence and advanced manufacturing.Hindalco is India’s largest flat rolled products player, accounting for over 50% of the domestic market. With nearly 40% of flat-rolled aluminium currently imported into India, the expanded FRP capacity is expected to reduce import dependence by nearly half, supporting domestic manufacturing and improving India’s competitiveness in high-grade aluminium products.Kumar Mangalam Birla, Chairman, Aditya Birla Group, said, “India’s manufacturing growth depends on integration, value addition and sustainability.

headline: Shriram Finance to expand new vehicle book as it targets 18% asset growth
condensed_text: As far as the construction equipment is concerned, the infrastructure activity in the last year has slowed down, so therefore there is a lower offtake of construction equipment, and that is the real slowdown for us.But we believe post-Budget things will become much better, with higher demand coming, because people are looking for a long-term understanding of the infrastructure, and I think the Budget will be a strong indicator for that.As far as MSMEs are concerned, we did see a slowdown in certain segments because some of the MSMEs were dependent on the US market, and because of the tariff uncertainty, the slowdown is there in the credit offtake. Markets are looking promising, and as and when they find new markets stabilised, the credit offtake will improve.Also Read | Granules India expects better March quarter; US FDA decision crucial for FY27 growthQ: So when you speak about the Budget and some improvement on your construction equipment portfolio on account of some of the announcements in infrastructure, could you detail what exactly you'd be watching out for, and how much of an improvement can we see in FY27 over the kind of performance that we see in FY26, especially as this large money also flows in, that is sure to boost some of your growth for the business?A: Infrastructure spending by the government will have multiple positive impacts for us, not only in construction equipment, but also in heavy commercial vehicles, because heavy commercial vehicles are mostly dependent on large transportation like cement and steel. Many of our customers who remain with us for 10 to 15 years then move to the competition or the bank when they want to upgrade themselves to buy a new vehicle, because new vehicles have a higher ticket size, and when they buy an asset of a higher ticket size, they would like to have competitive rates.And we would like to retain those customers, because we have a very large number of customers. We have given a long-term guidance of 8.5% to 9%, because some of the benefits, which will come to us ,will be passed on to the customer, especially to retain customers for buying new vehicles.So, there will be some range-bound situation as far as the net interest margin is concerned, and benefiting the customer also is one part of it.Q: So the MUFG deal closure timeline — that was the other question.A: It should be by the financial year-end. The process of application to the regulator and the CCA is in progress, and once we get approval, we should close it by the financial year-end.Q: With a lot more capital coming at your disposal right now, with a lot of scale, the fear is that you may disrupt the industry by growing a lot faster, or maybe giving loans at prices which will be a lot more attractive as against competitors.
Sector: NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES 25/50, NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES EX-BANK

headline: India-EU trade deal: Apex Frozen Foods shares surge 15%; here’s why
condensed_text: Apex Frozen Foods climbed Tuesday’s trade, riding the wave of optimism following the announcement of the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) between India and the European Union. At last check on Tuesday, Apex Frozen Foods shares were up 14.8% to Rs 302.75 on the BSE, a sharp jump against their previous close of Rs 263.50 apiece. The rally may have ignited by the government's confirmation that import duties on Indian marine products entering the EU, currently standing at a steep 26%, will be slashed to zero under the new pact. According to the company's investor presentation for Q2 FY26, the European Union (EU) market commands a massive 46% share of the company's sales mix for the first half of the fiscal year. Even as sales to the USA faced headwinds, declining by 10% due to tariff-led uncertainties, the company’s EU exports bucked the trend, registering a robust 18% year-on-year growth in the second quarter.

headline: Top Gainers & Losers: Karur Vysya Bank, MCX, Axis Bank among top gainers
condensed_text: The Indian stock market kicked off the holiday-shortened week on a positive note as investor sentiment appeared to have improved, driven by the finalisation of a free trade agreement between India and the European Union. While metals, tech and banking stocks offered strong support to the key indices, the sell-off in auto stocks limited gains, as concerns grew that competition would likely intensify following the sharp reduction in import taxes on European-made cars. Consequently, the Nifty 50 settled 0.51% higher at the 25,175 level, while the S&P BSE Sensex closed 0.66% higher at 82,077 points. Today, India concluded the biggest free trade agreement (FTA) in its history with the European Union, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said after holding summit talks with the 27-nation bloc's top leaders, Ursula von der Leyen and Antonio Costa. India will get “unprecedented” market access at concessional duties for over 99 per cent of its exports by value in the European Union (EU) market, providing a boost to domestic labour-intensive sectors, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said.

headline: Bandhan Bank to lower minimum balance requirement for savings accounts from Feb 1
condensed_text: Bandhan Bank will reduce the Monthly Average Balance  requirement for its Standard Savings Account from ₹5,000 to ₹2,000, effective February 1, 2026, the bank said.The revision will lower the minimum balance customers need to maintain in their savings accounts to avoid non-maintenance charges.Monthly Average Balance refers to the average amount maintained in an account over a month, calculated by averaging the end-of-day balances across all days in the month. Banks typically levy charges if the maintained average falls below the prescribed threshold.Once the change comes into effect, Bandhan Bank customers holding standard savings accounts will be required to maintain a monthly average balance of ₹2,000, compared with ₹5,000 earlier.The bank continues to offer a tiered interest rate structure on domestic and non-resident rupee savings deposits. As per the interest rate chart effective December 25, 2025, interest on savings accounts is calculated daily on the basis of end-of-day clear balances and credited at quarterly intervals.For balances up to ₹1 lakh, the interest rate stands at 2.70% per annum. Balances above ₹5 lakh up to ₹10 lakh earn 4.85% per annum, while balances above ₹10 lakh up to ₹50 lakh earn 5.35%. Deposits above ₹50 lakh up to ₹5 crore earn 5.55%, and balances above ₹5 crore up to ₹250 crore earn 6.00% per annum.For balances exceeding ₹250 crore, deposits above ₹250 crore up to ₹500 crore earn 6.15% per annum on the balance above ₹1 lakh, while balances above ₹500 crore up to ₹750 crore earn 6.85%.
Sector: NIFTY MIDSMALL FINANCIAL SERVICES, NIFTY PRIVATE BANK

headline: Apex Frozen, Avanti Feeds, other shrimp stocks rise up to 10% on India-EU trade deal optimism
condensed_text: Shares of Indian seafood exporters rose on Tuesday on optimism around the India-European Union trade deal, which is expected to lower tariffs on marine products over a phased period. According to the agreement, the European Union will cut tariffs on 99.5 percent of goods traded between the two sides over seven years, with duties on Indian marine products set to be reduced to zero. During the session, the stock touched an intraday high of Rs 786.40, up 4.15 percent, after opening with a gap-up gain of about 2 percent. On a year-to-date basis, Avanti Feeds is down about 8 percent, Apex Frozen Foods is up 6.7 percent, while Coastal Corporation has declined 7.7 percent. headline: Paras Defence says strong March quarter will aid up to 40% FY26 revenue growth
condensed_text: After a relatively softer growth in the first nine months, the company expects the final quarter to deliver the bulk of revenues, in line with the broader trend seen across defence manufacturers.Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Amit Mahajan, Director at Paras Defence and Space Technologies, said the company remains firmly on track to deliver revenue growth of 30–40% for the full year, supported by strong execution momentum and a robust pipeline of defence and space-related orders. Management expects FY26 revenues to close in the range of ₹450–500 crore, with the March quarter contributing the highest share.Looking ahead, Paras Defence sees its order book strengthening further over the next few months, driven by demand across optics, optical systems, laser-based solutions, ground-to-space telescopes and defence electronics.With order inflows expected to accelerate into FY27 and margins set to improve on the back of high-value execution, the company remains optimistic about sustaining growth while expanding profitability in defence and space technologies.In the October–December quarter , Paras Defence reported revenue of ₹106 crore, net profit of ₹17 crore, and margins of 24.65%.Below are the edited excerpts of the interview.Q: Your revenue growth this nine-month period, you have not seen the growth that you are envisaging for the full year. What is it that one could expect in terms of the guidance for FY26 would you want to lower the guidance for the full year?A: The quarter one, quarter two, quarter three, we are on course for minimum growth of 30% and we will continue to keep our guidance to 30 to 40%, because the quarter four which is where we are into, is the most happening quarter in all the defence companies and we are on it for a good growth.Q: Can you just elaborate a little more, what exactly are you expecting? So there are certain some things that get spill over to the next year, but 5% here and there, I don't think is a big cut down.Q: Just to reiterate, your closing the year with ₹450 crores?A: Yes.Q: But the earlier guidance was around ₹511 crores so we are working with maybe a lesser amount now?A: We are looking still at between ₹450 to 500 crores per se.Q: What is the order inflow looking like for you in FY27, if you could give us more colour in terms of the kind of orders that you bid for, and what we will hear from the company in terms of order wins, say in quarter four as well as say, maybe going into quarter one?A: We are looking at orders coming in for the optics and optical systems, majorly, and those orders are related to, say, a laser system. Is that something you will sustain, and given that execution we're expecting will be more in this quarter four period as well then Are these high margin execution orders that you will see?A: The margins will improve than what we have seen till now, and you are right, between 27 to 30% on an EBITDA level, and PAT between seven, between 18 to 20% is what we are expecting.For the entire discussion, watch the accompanying video

headline: WeWork India adds 10,000 desks in Q3, plans up to 30,000 new seats in FY27
condensed_text: Virwani said WeWork India is likely to add 25,000–30,000 seats in the fiscal year 2026-27 , supported by recent enterprise deals and expansion of its branded flexible office spaces.“Capacity addition has been roughly in the 20% range, and it will continue at that pace,” he said.On an adjusted basis, WeWork India’s revenue rose 9.6% sequentially to ₹634 crore in the October–December 2025 quarter. And the way next year is looking, it will be roughly in the range of 25,000 to 30,000 seat additions for next year as well, a lot of them driven by some strong back-to-back deals that we've won over the last few quarters, as well as our expansion of WeWork-branded spaces that we continue to see a lot of demand for.Capacity addition has been roughly in the 20% range, and it will continue to accelerate at that pace, even for next year.Q: You have plans to take your total capacity to somewhere around 11.4 million square feet over a period of time. So great visibility on the portfolio from now till then it's almost a 40% capacity growth that we'll see coming in the next two financial years, and our CapEx spend will be roughly in the range of ₹300 to ₹400 crore for spaces, and then some other additional CapEx for refurbishments and things like that which we do on the existing portfolio.Q: When you talk about capex, ₹300 to ₹400 crore, what will you be funding it with — free cash flow completely? By the end of the next financial year, we aim to continue to keep net debt at zero, even as we may raise some small debt for some of this capex financing.Also Read | JSW Energy on track for 15 GW capacity by FY26-end, plans ₹10,000 crore fundraise if neededQ: Just wanted to get more of an idea with regard to what you are doing in the luxury property space. If you look at hospitality, hotels, etc., we are far above that when it comes to low-cost margins, which is a good reflection of how pricing, costs, and capex spend are playing out.For the full interview, watch the accompanying videoCatch all the latest updates from the stock market hereCatch the latest Budget 2026 expectations updates hereCatch all the latest updates from the Q3 earnings here

headline: India, EU sign landmark security pact; conclude FTA talks
condensed_text: India, EU sign landmark security pact; conclude FTA talks. India and the European Union signed a Security and Defence Partnership Agreement on Tuesday, January 27, to boost cooperation in areas such as maritime security, defence technology and industry.The partnership was signed on the sidelines of the visit of European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and European Council President Antonio Costa to New Delhi.Prime Minister Narendra Modi and von der Leyen also announced the conclusion of negotiations on the India-EU Free Trade Agreement , which aims to enhance bilateral ties, drive shared prosperity, and strengthen resilient and diversified supply chains, according to the India-EU joint statement.The India-EU Security and Defence Partnership is the first overarching defence and security framework between the two sides. It seeks to deepen cooperation in maritime security, defence industry and technology, cyber and hybrid threats, space, counter-terrorism, and other areas.Both sides also launched negotiations on a Security of Information Agreement, which will facilitate the exchange of classified information and pave the way for stronger cooperation in security and defence.As part of their long-term vision, Prime Minister Modi and von der Leyen adopted “Towards 2030: India–EU Joint Comprehensive Strategic Agenda” to elevate strategic cooperation between the two sides.The agenda aims to accelerate progress across five key pillars: prosperity and sustainability; technology and innovation; security and defence; connectivity and global challenges; and enabling factors such as skills, mobility, business, and people-to-people ties.Earlier in the day, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh held talks with European Union’s chief of foreign and security affairs, Kaja Kallas, in New Delhi, ahead of the India-EU Summit.The leaders discussed a range of bilateral security and defence issues, including opportunities for integrating supply chains to build trusted defence ecosystems and future-ready capabilities, Singh said in a post on X .Delighted to meet High Representative/Vice President  of the European Commission Ms. Kaja Kallas in New Delhi today.Discussed a range of bilateral security and defence issues including oppurtunities for integrating supply chains for building trusted defence ecosystems… pic.twitter.com/hTrPj46Tt8— Rajnath Singh  January 27, 2026

headline: Marico Q3 net profit up 12%
condensed_text:
Marico Ltd reported a 12 per cent rise in third quarter net profit, while revenue rose 26.6 per cent on good growth in its India and international business due to a boost in consumer demand. The maker of Parachute oil reported consolidated net profit of ₹447 crore on revenue of ₹3,537 crore. The India business saw an underlying volume growth of 8 per cent. Around 95 per cent of Marico’s business gained or sustained market share, it said, while 80 per cent gained or sustained market penetration. Published on  January 27, 2026

headline: Hindalco unveils ₹21,000-crore aluminium smelter expansion in Odisha
condensed_text:
Hindalco Industries announced a ₹21,000-crore expansion of its aluminium smelter at Sambalpur, Odisha , on Tuesday, while commissioning a ₹4,500-crore flat-rolled products and battery foil manufacturing facility. The battery-grade aluminium foil plant, India’s first, can support up to 100 GWh of lithium-ion cell manufacturing capacity, directly feeding from the FRP complex. Tilaknagar Industries reshuffles top finance leadership
The announcements are part of Hindalco’s ₹37,000-crore investment plan for Odisha and form a significant portion of its overall ₹55,000-crore growth capital expenditure across India. MCX shares surge 4.8% as Q3 profit jumps 151% on strong volume growth
The Aditya Birla Group company has invested over ₹25,000 crore in Odisha over 15 years across bauxite mining, alumina refining and aluminium smelting. The shares of Hindalco Industries Ltd ended on the NSE today at ₹964 up by ₹13.70 or 1.44 per cent.

headline: HDFC Life, ICICI Pru reset distributor terms amid ITC hit
condensed_text:
The impact of the GST-driven input tax credit (ITC) loss on life insurers seems to be playing out most sharply in the bancassurance channel during Q3 FY26 for both HDFC Life and ICICI Prudential Life, where parent banks continue to account for a large share of new business. “Short answer is negotiations were completed, and it’s moved on in terms of what we said that we would do,” MD & CEO Vibha Padalkar said, adding that discussions with all distributors are now concluded and the company has transitioned to the new structure. “Input tax credit is no longer available and that cost has been taken on the P&L and VNB,” it said, adding that any benefit going forward would come through commission rationalisation rather than ITC reversals. “If you look at the two-year CAGR, growth is reasonably strong, and we believe the channel will continue to deliver.”
The insurer expects growth to normalise in FY27 as bancassurance stabilises and proprietary channels scale up. At ICICI Prudential Life, bancassurance grew 10.5 percent year-on-year in Q3 FY26, contributing 26.7 percent to APE, which is a relatively lower number compared to the previous quarters for the company, with ICICI Bank continuing to deliver steady volumes.
Sector: NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES 25/50, NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES EX-BANK
Index: NIFTY 100, NIFTY 200, NIFTY 50, NIFTY 500, NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES

headline: Marico Q3 Results: Profit tops estimates as India, international growth lifts revenue 27%
condensed_text: Marico Ltd delivered a better-than-expected performance in the December quarter, with profit and operating earnings surpassing Street estimates on the back of strong revenue growth across India and overseas markets.Net profit rose 13.3% year-on-year to ₹460 crore, ahead of the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of ₹445 crore. Revenue jumped 26.6% to ₹3,537 crore, marginally higher than estimates, reflecting broad-based growth across categories and geographies.EBITDA increased 11.1% year-on-year to ₹592 crore, also beating expectations, while margins stood at 16.7%, in line with estimates but lower than 19.1% a year ago, amid input cost pressures and investments behind growth.India business remains resilientIndia revenues grew 28% year-on-year, with over 95% of the portfolio gaining or sustaining market share and around 80% improving penetration on a MAT basis.Parachute Coconut Oil, which contributes 36% of India revenues, saw 2% volume growth after normalising for ml-age reductions. Saffola edible oils, accounting for 16% of India revenues, reported a marginal decline in volumes.International business delivers strong momentumInternational revenues rose 24% year-on-year in rupee terms, with constant currency growth of 21% in Q3 and 20% for the nine months ended FY26, underlining steady demand across key markets.Strategic moves sharpen portfolioEarlier in the day, Marico announced a strategic investment in Zea Maize, the owner of premium snacking brand 4700BC. The 4700BC brand has seen rapid growth, with FY25 revenue at ₹98.66 crore.Separately, Marico said it will integrate its digital-first Beardo business by voluntarily liquidating its wholly owned subsidiary Zed Lifestyle and transferring the undertaking to the parent company. The move is expected to drive operational synergies without materially impacting consolidated financials.Outlook remains constructiveMarico said it remains on track to deliver double-digit EBITDA margins by FY27, with exit annual recurring revenue  expected to reach around 2.5x of FY24 levels, upgraded from earlier guidance.

headline: Vedanta board approves sale of 1.59% stake in Hindustan Zinc via OFS
condensed_text: Oil-to-metals conglomerate Vedanta Ltd on Tuesday  said its duly authorised Committee of Directors has approved the sale of up to 1.59% stake in Hindustan Zinc Ltd through an offer for sale route.The proposed sale involves up to 6.7 crore equity shares of Hindustan Zinc Ltd, representing 1.59% of the issued and paid-up equity share capital of the company. Vedanta said the transaction will be executed through the stock exchange mechanism in line with applicable laws and the circulars issued by the Sebi.Third Quarter ResultsNet profit for the period grew by 47% from the same quarter last year to ₹3,879 crore from ₹2,647 crore. Profitability was also aided by a 33% increase in other income.Also Read: Silver price rally makes Hindustan Zinc India's most valued metals stockEarnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation  for the quarter stood at ₹6,005 crore, higher than the CNBC-TV18 poll of ₹5,614 crore. On a year-on-year basis, Hindustan Zinc's EBITDA increased by 34.7%.EBITDA margin for the quarter expanded by 300 basis points to 55% from 52% last year. The margin figure was also in-line with the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of 54.9%.Shares of Hindustan Zinc Ltd ended at ₹726.60, up by ₹27.75, or 3.97%, on the BSE.

headline: JSW Steel shares jump 5% after net profit surges 198% to Rs 717 crore: Here's what brokerages say
condensed_text:
JSW Steel Q3 Results:
JSW Steel reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,139 crore for Q3 FY26, marking a 198 percent year-on-year (YoY) rise from Rs 717 crore net profit reported in Q3 FY25. Motilal Oswal on JSW Steel:
Motilal Oswal said the company’s revenue was in-line with estimates, mainly on account of strong volume, which was partially offset by muted NSR. We believe JSTL is well-placed with new capacities coming on-stream, strong domestic demand, and a rising share of value-added proportion in the sales mix. PL Capital on JSW Steel:
PL Capital upgraded the shares of JSW Steel to ‘Accumulate’ with a target price of Rs 1,292 apiece. It expects the company to improve its market share over the next few years due to its superior execution capabilities, downstream focus and significant deleveraging post JFE-BPSL deal.

headline: ICICI Prudential AMC turns constructive on equities, sees opportunity after market correction
condensed_text: The fund house has reopened subscriptions in its small-cap funds and select international schemes, signalling renewed confidence in market opportunities.Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Chintan Haria, Principal – Investment Strategy at ICICI Prudential AMC, which manages assets worth nearly $3.03 billion, said that while Indian equities have been strong performers over the past year and a half, recent market corrections have improved the risk-reward balance for long-term investors.He said valuations are not as cheap as past crisis periods, but the current phase offers a reasonable entry point for investors starting their equity journey, based on their asset allocation needs.Haria pointed out that market participation has broadened significantly. He said value is emerging in large-cap and mega-cap stocks that have underperformed over the last year.From a sectoral perspective, ICICI Prudential AMC is watching energy, financials and technology closely. These sectors have seen meaningful underperformance despite stable fundamentals.Low crude oil prices have led to a correction in oil and gas stocks, while foreign investor selling has weighed on financials, even as earnings remain steady. Technology stocks have also lagged, creating selective opportunities.The AMC has also reopened select international funds, including its Strategic Metals and Energy Fund. He added that these funds can be considered either as part of equity allocation or as an alternative to gold exposure.On global investing, Haria said international diversification remains important, especially as currency movements, inflation risks and global commodity trends continue to evolve.For full interview, watch accompanying video

headline: India-EU trade deal: Why IFB Agro, Sula Vineyards, United Spirits & other brewery stocks declined
condensed_text: Shares of select beverage companies, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic, came under selling pressure on Tuesday as investors assessed the potential implications of the recently concluded India-European Union (EU) trade agreement. IFB Agro Industries Ltd slipped 5 per cent, while Winsome Breweries Ltd fell 5.04 per cent and Fratelli Vineyards Ltd declined 4.64 per cent. United Spirits Ltd ended 1.58 per cent lower, Radico Khaitan Ltd declined 1.55 per cent and United Breweries Ltd settled 1.38 per cent down. In the non-alcoholic space, Orient Beverages Ltd slipped 3.16 per cent, while Varun Beverages Ltd (PepsiCo franchisee operator) declined 0.59 per cent. Commenting on the development, Kranthi Bathini, Director – Equity Strategy at WealthMills Securities, said, "At present, the near-term impact of India-EU trade deal on breweries will be neutral by and large as tariffs are implemented in a phased manner.

headline: IndiGo cancels flights to Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku and Tashkent till February 11 amid Iran tensions
condensed_text:
IndiGo on Tuesday announced the cancellation of its flights to Tbilisi, Almaty, Tashkent and Baku till 11 February, citing escalating tensions in the region around Iran and the need to prioritise passenger and crew safety. As part of these measures, flights to and from Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku and Tashkent have been cancelled for now.IndiGosaid flight operations remain under continuous review and that any further updates or changes will be communicated to passengers in a timely manner. As part of these measures, IndiGo flights… — IndiGo (@IndiGo6E)January 27, 2026
“We remain vigilant to developments in the region around Iran and are proactively reviewing flight operations, with safety being our highest priority,” the airline said in a post on X on Sunday. The development came as US President Donald Trump said on Thursday (local time) that the United States is closely monitoring Iran as a "massive fleet" of naval forces moves toward the Gulf region, underscoring rising tensions between Washington and Tehran. However, the US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency (HRANA) has said 4,519 were killed during the wave of demonstrations, including 4,251 protesters, 197 security personnel, 35 people aged under 18 and 38 bystanders who it says were neither protesters nor security personnel.

headline: Investec backs Paytm’s digital toll road, sees upside despite PIDF overhang
condensed_text: Investec has reiterated its positive stance on One 97 Communications , the parent of Paytm , highlighting the company’s expanding “digital toll road” across payments and merchant services as a key long-term growth driver. According to the brokerage, Paytm is well placed to benefit from rising credit-linked payments, strong operating leverage and oligopolistic market structures, and it forecasts a 23 per cent revenue CAGR with EBITDA margins expanding to 24 per cent by FY28, prompting a buy rating on the stock at ₹1,550 target price (a 35 per cent upside potential from current levels). Another brokerage JM Financial said Paytm’s stock recently corrected sharply after market worries emerged over the status of the Payment Infrastructure Development Fund (PIDF) incentive, following references in a draft prospectus filed by a private player. JM Financial believes Paytm could deploy offsetting measures such as higher monetisation and tighter sales execution, reducing the potential earnings impact to about 11 per cent in FY27 and 5 per cent in FY28. On Friday, One 97 Communications said the company had recognised incentives under the RBI’s scheme for qualifying expenditure on deploying payment acceptance devices such as soundboxes and EDC machines, particularly in Tier-3 to Tier-6 centres, the north-eastern states and the Union Territories of Jammu, Kashmir and Ladakh.

headline: NTPC Q3FY26 preview: Weak power demand may weigh but regulated model could steady earnings
condensed_text:
According to a Moneycontrol poll of 6 brokerages, revenue is estimated to rise 7.7 percent year-on-year to Rs 44,525.3 crore in Q3FY26, from Rs 41,352.3 crore in Q3FY25, reflecting steady topline growth. Net profit is projected to increase 6.6 percent YoY to Rs 5,023.7 crore, compared with Rs 4,711 crore in the year-ago quarter, supported by improved operating leverage. Regulated cost-plus model limits earnings volatility
Despite weaker generation, NTPC’s earnings are expected to remain relatively stable due to its regulated business framework, under which returns are linked to regulated equity rather than volumes. Motilal Oswal expects ~8% YoY growth in revenue and EBITDA and ~7% growth in adjusted PAT, while Antique noted that lower PLFs have limited impact on profitability under the cost-plus structure. Capacity additions aid equity base, ramp-up gradual
Antique highlighted that NTPC’s installed capacity increased on both standalone and consolidated bases during the quarter, with capacity commercialised on a consolidated basis supporting incremental regulated equity growth.

headline: MMTC appoints Asit Gopal as government nominee director
condensed_text: MMTC appoints Asit Gopal as government nominee director. State-owned MMTC Ltd on Tuesday  said Asit Gopal has been appointed as a government nominee director on the board, pursuant to an office order issued by the Department of Commerce, Ministry of Commerce & Industry, Government of India. The appointment was made on January 27, 2026.Gopal is currently serving as Special Secretary and Financial Advisor in the Ministry of Textiles, with additional charge of several other ministries, including Commerce & Industry.Last week, MMTC-PAMP said it is planning to start silver recycling at its existing stores on a pilot basis within three months as rising demand threatens to create serious supply-side constraints, the company’s top executive said.Also Read: India, EU conclude ‘mother of all deals’, announce landmark free trade agreementManaging Director and CEO Samit Guha said the company is entering silver recycling because the economics are now more favourable, while global mine production capacity shows no signs of significant expansion despite growing demand.Second Quarter ResultsMMTC had reported a standalone profit of ₹133.59 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared with a profit of ₹36.67 crore in the preceding June quarter. Profit for the corresponding quarter last year stood at ₹38.16 crore.Total income during the September quarter came in at ₹38.47 crore, lower than ₹71.56 crore in the June quarter and ₹44.58 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue from operations stood at ₹1.10 crore, while other income was ₹37.37 crore.Also Read: India, EU sign landmark security pact; conclude FTA talksMMTC Ltd shares closed at ₹64.97 on the NSE on January 27, up ₹1.14 or 1.79%.

headline: Vedanta to sell 1.59% Hindustan Zinc stake worth $531.3 million
condensed_text: Vedanta to sell 1.59% Hindustan Zinc stake worth $531.3 million. Indian ‍oil-to-metals conglomerate Vedanta said ​on Tuesday it ‌will sell ​a 1.59 per cent stake in unit Hindustan Zinc, valued at ₹4,872 crore ($531.3 million), according to ​Reuters calculations. As ⁠of December 31, Vedanta held 61.84 per cent of ​the zinc ⁠and silver miner. The Indian government is Hindustan Zinc's second-largest ‌shareholder, with a ‌27.92 per cent stake. Vedanta has sold portions of its stake in Hindustan Zinc twice in ⁠the past two years to ​help shore up ⁠its balance sheet.

headline: Vodafone Idea Q3 Results: Net loss narrows to₹5,286 crore
condensed_text: Vodafone Idea announced its financial performance for the December-ending quarter on January 27, post-market hours, reporting a net loss of ₹ 5,286 crore, lower than the net loss of ₹ 6,609 crore recorded in the same period last year. The lower-than-expected drop in net profit can be attributed to a decline in expenses, which stood at ₹ 17,884 crore compared with ₹ 17,974 crore in the same period last year. The company’s revenue from operations increased 2% year-on-year and 1.15% quarter-on-quarter to ₹ 11,323 crore, also surpassing Bloomberg’s estimate of ₹ 11,297 crore. Abhijit Kishore, CEO, Vodafone Idea Limited, said "This quarter marked an important inflection point for the company with positive resolution of key legacy issues. After the AGR dues freeze, the telecom company’s total outgo towards AGR payments over the next six years from March 2026 to March 2031 would be ₹ 744 crore, a maximum of ₹ 124 crore per year.

headline: Hindalco announces Rs 21,000-crore aluminium smelter expansion plan in Odisha
condensed_text: In a statement,Hindalcosaid, "The company flagged a Rs 21,000-crore, 3.6 lakh-tonne-per-annum smelter expansion at its Aditya Aluminium complex in Sambalpur and commissioned a 1.7 lakh tonne-per-annum Flat Rolled Products (FRP) and battery-grade aluminium foil manufacturing facility with an investment of Rs 4,500 crore." With nearly 40 per cent of flat-rolled aluminium imported into India, the expanded FRP capacity is likely to reduce import dependence by nearly half, supporting domestic manufacturing and improving India's competitiveness in high-grade aluminium products. The smelter expansion at Aditya Aluminium will also mark a step forward in energy transition, with a portion of its power requirement planned to be met through round-the-clock renewable energy, integrating sustainability considerations into large-scale industrial growth. Hindalco's presence in Odisha spans over 15 years during which it has already invested more than Rs 25,000 crore across bauxite mining, alumina refining, primary aluminium smelting, and downstream manufacturing. The broader investment pipeline includes the FRP and battery foil manufacturing facilities, the primary aluminium smelter expansion, Kansariguda alumina refinery, Meenakshi coal mine, specialised materials such as white fused alumina, and ancillary manufacturing units, further consolidating Odisha's status as a national hub for aluminium excellence.

headline: India eyes deeper energy ties with Canada in LNG, critical minerals, clean energy
condensed_text: “India, as a major consumer and Canada as a safe, secure and reliable supplier, can act in partnership to deepen trade and ensure stable and secure energy supplies,” the government said. There’s a lot of potential in critical minerals, also small modular reactors and a lot of our companies which started off as traditional oil companies have moved to green energy,” Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said. Recognizing that there exists a huge potential for cooperation in clean energy value chains, the two sides noted the opportunities for collaboration in renewable energy, including hydrogen, biofuels and sustainable aviation fuel; battery storage; critical minerals; clean technologies; electricity systems; energy supply chain resilience, and the application of artificial intelligence in the energy sector. Canada has stated its goal of becoming an energy superpower in clean and conventional energy, with export diversification as a priority while India offers a natural and symbiotic partnership grounded in scale, stability, and long-term opportunity, the government said. Canada has current and emerging liquefied natural gas (LNG) projects, is increasing production and exports of crude oil to markets in Asia via the Trans Mountain Expansion (TMX) Pipeline and is advancing liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) exports to Asia via the west coast of Canada.

headline: Vodafone Idea narrows Q3 loss to Rs 5,286 crore; ARPU, EBITDA improve
condensed_text: Telecom operator Vodafone Idea Ltd (Vi) reported a marginal narrowing of its net loss to Rs 5,286 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2024, compared with a loss of Rs 6,609 crore in the corresponding period last year. One of the key milestones during the quarter was the successful raising of Rs 3,300 crore through non-convertible debentures (NCDs), despite the AGR overhang, reflecting lender confidence in the company’s turnaround prospects.“These developments have strengthened the trajectory of our debt discussions, enabling us to execute our larger capex plan to strengthen the network and further elevate customer experience. As of December 31, 2025, the company’s AGR liability stood at Rs 80,502 crore, originally scheduled to be repaid in six equal instalments beginning March 31, 2026. On January 8, 2026, the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) informed the company that its AGR dues — including principal, interest, penalty and interest on penalty — for the period from FY2006-07 to FY2018-19, as of December 31, 2025, would be frozen and repaid under a revised framework. Under the new schedule, the company will pay up to Rs 124 crore annually over six years from March 2026 to March 2031, followed by annual payments of Rs 100 crore over the next four years from March 2032 to March 2035.

headline: GAIL to consider FY26 interim dividend on Jan 31; record date set for Feb 5. Check tax rules
condensed_text: Investors should know that the provisions of the Income Tax Act, 1961 (the IT Act) following an amendment by the Finance Act, 2020 made the dividend taxable in the hands of shareholders with effect from April 1, 2020. Tax deductions for residents 1) Valid PAN updated with the depository participant Shareholders can update with the depository participant by submitting the PAN / Email ID / Mobile Number before the record date so that TDS will be deducted at 10% (where applicable). 2) No PAN / Invalid PAN/ Inoperative PAN: 20% 3) Availability of a lower/nil tax deduction certificate issued by Income Tax Department u/s 197 of the IT Act: Rate specified in Lower tax withholding certificate obtained from IT department. 6) Category I and II Alternative Investment Fund (AIF): NIL / Category III AIF: 10% Non-resident shareholders Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs): 20% (plus applicable surcharge and cess) or tax treaty rate. AIF Category III located in IFSC: 10% (plus applicable surcharge and cess) For Sovereign Wealth funds and Pension funds notified by Central Government u/s 10(23FE) of the IT Act the tax deductions are NIL.

headline: Gopal Snacks posts healthy Q3; profit up 3x, margins double, dividend declared
condensed_text: Gopal Snacks posts healthy Q3; profit up 3x, margins double, dividend declared. Gopal Snacks on Tuesday, January 27, reported a sharp improvement in profitability for the December quarter, with net profit rising nearly three-fold to ₹15.4 crore from ₹5.3 crore in the year-ago period, aided by strong operating leverage and margin expansion.Revenue from operations in Q3 grew 1.6% year-on-year to ₹399.6 crore from ₹393.5 crore, even as the company continued to manage operational disruptions following the fire incident at its Rajkot facility last year.Operating performance strengthened significantly, with EBITDA jumping 88.6% year-on-year to ₹29.24 crore from ₹15.5 crore a year earlier. EBITDA margin expanded to 7.32% in the December quarter, nearly doubling from 3.93% in the corresponding period last year, reflecting better cost control and improved efficiencies.Also read: Axis Bank overtakes Kotak Mahindra Bank to become third-largest private lender by Market CapProfit before tax for the quarter stood at ₹19.1 crore, compared with ₹7.5 crore a year ago. The quarter also included a marginal exceptional gain of ₹0.08 crore related to the sale of scrap from assets affected by the Rajkot fire incident.For the nine months ended December 31, 2025, the company reported a net profit of ₹43.7 crore, compared with ₹58.5 crore in the year-ago period, while revenue stood at ₹1,091.9 crore versus ₹1,150.5 crore last year.The board of directors has declared a second interim dividend of ₹0.35 per equity share of face value ₹1 each for FY26. The record date for the dividend has been fixed as February 2, 2026, and the payout will be made on or before February 24, 2026.Also read: Motilal Oswal Q3 Results: Revenue up 18% as asset, wealth management drive growth; dividend declaredThe company said it has scaled up production at its Modasa and Nagpur facilities to offset the temporary closure of the Rajkot plant, and has also commissioned a new namkeen facility at Modasa during the quarter to support distribution across Rajasthan, parts of Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh.Shares of Gopal Snacks ended 0.41% lower at ₹294.80 ahead of the announcement on Tuesday.

headline: Metro Brands Q3 Results: Profit surges 36% to ₹128 cr on festive sales, GST cut
condensed_text: Footwear retailer Metro Brands Ltd on Tuesday  reported a net profit of ₹128.3 crore for Q3, up 35.6% from ₹94.6 crore a year ago.Revenue grew 15.4% to ₹811 crore, compared with ₹703.1 crore in the same period last year, driven by strong festive and wedding season demand, supported by a reduction in GST on footwear priced below ₹2,500.For the nine-month period ended December 2025, the company recorded a 12% revenue growth. EBITDA for the quarter increased 18.1% to ₹265.2 crore from ₹224.6 crore in Q3 last year, while the EBITDA margin expanded to 32.7% from 31.9% year-on-year.Also Read: Metro Brands to cut prices on 40% of its products after GST revision: CEOE-commerce and omni-channel sales grew 24% during the quarter, contributing 12% of revenue, compared to 11% in Q3FY25. Over the nine-month period, 100 new stores were added, offset by 18 closures, reflecting a calibrated approach to network expansion.MetroActiv, the company’s multi-brand sports performance retail concept, was launched in Indore, Dehradun, and Jodhpur, along with the launch of its e-commerce platform.The company currently operates six Foot Locker stores in India, though new store additions are being moderated due to BIS-related supply challenges faced by select external brands.Also Read: Metro Brands builds growth momentum with focus on activewear and new marketsFILA footwear manufacturing has been localised in India, with 2-3 exclusive brand outlets planned in Q4FY26. Under its exclusive partnership with New Era Cap, LLC, Metro Brands operates four stores and five kiosks across India.Nissan Joseph, CEO, Metro Brands Limited, said, "I'm pleased to see our growth momentum continue with a 15% increase in revenue. "Shares of Metro Brands Ltd ended at ₹1,066.50, up by ₹44.50, or 4.35%, on the BSE today, January 27.Also Read: Metro Brands confident on long-term margins despite higher investments: CEO

headline: RVNL bags ₹242.5-crore South Central Railway upgrade project
condensed_text: RVNL bags ₹242.5-crore South Central Railway upgrade project. Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd  has emerged as the lowest bidder  for a key overhead electrification  upgrade project under South Central Railway, the company announced on Tuesday, January 27.The contract is for the “Design, Supply, Erection, Testing and Commissioning for OHE upgradation of existing 1X25kV system to 2X25kV at Feeding System with Feeder and Earthing works in Ongole   - Gudur   section of Vijayawada Division under South Central Railway, Total 154 RKM/ 462 TKM,” according to an exchange filing.The company said the order has been awarded by South Central Railway, a domestic entity.As per the filing, the time period by which the order is to be executed is 24 months. The broad consideration or size of the order is ₹242.50 crore, including applicable taxes.Earlier, on January 16, RVNL had also announced that it was the lowest bidder  for another contract from South Eastern Railway. The order, valued at ₹87.56 crore excluding GST, is for the supply, installation and commissioning of an IP-based video surveillance system  in LHB coaches.Shares of RVNL ended marginally higher on Tuesday, January 27, by 0.23% at ₹325.90 on the NSE.Also Read: Mahindra Logistics Q3 Results: Turns profitable after 11 quarters as margin improves

headline: Titagarh Rail, ABB India partner on 25kV driverless metro propulsion, tech transfer
condensed_text: Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd  on Tuesday  said the company and ABB India Ltd have taken a significant step to develop propulsion systems and enable technology transfer for 25kV driverless metro projects in India.Under the agreement, ABB India will support the design, manufacture, supply, testing, installation supervision, and commissioning of propulsion systems, along with the transfer of technology for the Train Control and Monitoring System  for 25 kV AC metro applications. Titagarh had earlier secured a contract to deliver 240 metro coaches, comprising 132 cars for Line 5 and 108 cars for Line 6.Also Read: Titagarh Rail Systems bags ₹2,481 crore Mumbai Metro line 5 order from MMRDAThe scope includes Line 5  and Line 6 , 15.60 km, 13 stations), along with five years of maintenance following a two-year Defect Liability Period .The agreement marks a major milestone for Titagarh’s commitment to the Make in India and Atmanirbhar Bharat initiatives. Last year, Titagarh also established a TCMS laboratory at its design centre in Bengaluru.Also Read: Titagarh Rail wins ₹273-crore Indian Railways order for 62 maintenance vehiclesFurther, Titagarh is already producing traction motors for locomotives and EMUs, and under this agreement with ABB, Titagarh will progressively co-produce propulsion systems for metro applications, which are considered to be of high precision and technology. Titagarh, which has also recently developed the traction converter for EMUs, is under an earlier transfer of manufacturing agreement with ABB.Propulsion systems, including TCMS, are one of the key components of a metro train, responsible for controlling and monitoring complete train operations. For Titagarh, this contract represents a major move towards backward integration and indigenous manufacturing, significantly increasing local content and bringing the project close to majority localisation.Shares of Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd ended at ₹789.00, up by ₹3.65, or 0.46%, on the BSE.Also Read: Titagarh Rail rolls out first driverless metro trainset for Ahmedabad

headline: ONGC JV signs shipbuilding contracts with Samsung for two Indian-flag ethane carriers
condensed_text: The contracts mark a fast-tracked collaboration among India, Japan, and South Korea.This initiative aims to strengthen India’s energy ecosystem by securing specialised marine logistics for critical feedstock, enhancing supply chain resilience, and promoting long-term industrial self-reliance. The Indian-flag VLECs will ensure continuity of operations across petrochemicals and downstream value chains dependent on stable ethane supplies.ONGC and MOL have established two joint venture companies—Bharat Ethane One IFSC Private Ltd and Bharat Ethane Two IFSC Private Ltd—based in GIFT City, Gujarat, with each company owning and operating one VLEC. Each vessel will have a cargo capacity of 100,000 cubic meters and is expected to transport about 600 KTPA of ethane for OPaL, ONGC’s subsidiary.Also Read: ONGC acquires 50% in two JVs with Mitsui OSK for ₹40 cr to expedite ethane transportLong-term Time Charter Party agreements have also been signed with the JV companies to facilitate the shipping of ethane from the USA to India, establishing a dedicated energy corridor. The VLECs are scheduled for delivery in FY 2028–29.The signing ceremony was attended by Hardeep Singh Puri, Minister of Petroleum & Natural Gas; Dr Neeraj Mittal, Secretary ; and Arun Kumar Singh, Chairman & CEO, ONGC. Managing Executive Officer , and Sung-an Choi, CEO .Shares of Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd ended at ₹248.00, up by ₹2.45, or 1.00%, on the BSE.Also Read: ONGC, Oil India shares gain for fourth straight day on elevated crude prices

headline: Vodafone Idea Q3 Results: Losses narrow QoQ as ARPU rises; AGR reassessment underway
condensed_text: Vodafone Idea Ltd reported a steady improvement in its financial performance for the third quarter, with losses narrowing on a sequential basis, supported by higher average revenue per user  and improved operating metrics.The telecom operator posted a net loss of ₹5,286 crore for Q3, compared with a loss of ₹5,524 crore in the previous quarter. EBITDA margin expanded to 42.5% from 41.8% in Q2.ARPU improved to ₹186 in Q3FY26 from ₹173 a year earlier, marking a 7.3% year-on-year increase, primarily driven by customer upgrades. The company’s total subscriber base stood at 19.29 crore, with 12.85 crore 4G and 5G subscribers, up from 12.6 crore in the year-ago period.Capital expenditure during the quarter stood at ₹2,252 crore, taking total capex for the first nine months of FY26 to ₹6,448 crore.As of December 31, 2025, bank debt stood at ₹1,126 crore. During the quarter, the company raised ₹3,300 crore through non-convertible debentures , while cash and bank balances stood at ₹6,963 crore.Vodafone Idea said the NCD fundraising was completed ahead of clarity on the adjusted gross revenue  matter, reflecting lender confidence in the company’s turnaround.The Vodafone Group is also supporting closure of CLAM receivables worth ₹6,394 crore, with the AGR payment no longer a pre-condition. Of this, around ₹2,300 crore is expected to be received over the next 12 months.The company said its AGR liability has been frozen at ₹87,695 crore as of December 31, 2025, subject to reassessment.

headline: Sunteck Realty Q3 profit jumps 34% as revenue more than doubles to ₹344 crore
condensed_text: For the December quarter, the Mumbai-based real estate developer reported revenue of about ₹344 crore, registering a year-on-year growth of 113%.EBITDA for the quarter rose to around ₹82 crore, up 68% year-on-year, while profit after tax stood at approximately ₹57 crore, marking a 34% increase from the year-ago period. EBITDA margin for Q3FY26 was 24% and PAT margin stood at 17%.For the nine months ended FY26, revenue increased to about ₹785 crore, up 21% year-on-year. EBITDA grew to around ₹207 crore, reflecting a 77% year-on-year rise, while profit after tax came in at approximately ₹139 crore, up 39 per cent from the corresponding period last year. EBITDA margin for the nine-month period stood at 26% and PAT margin at 18 per cent.Also Read: ONGC JV signs shipbuilding contracts with Samsung for two Indian-flag ethane carriersOn the operational front, pre-sales rose to about ₹734 crore in Q3FY26 and ₹2,093 crore in the nine-month period, up 16% and 26% year-on-year, respectively. Collections were reported at approximately ₹319 crore for the quarter and ₹1,001 crore for the nine months.The company reported a net operating cash flow surplus of around ₹349 crore, up 12% year-on-year, while its net debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.07x.The company also informed that it has acquired a strategic 1.75-acre land parcel at Andheri, near the Mumbai international airport, with the project estimated to have a gross development value of around ₹25 billion.Also Read: Titagarh Rail, ABB India partner on 25kV driverless metro propulsion, tech transferShares of Sunteck Realty closed at ₹374.55, up ₹4.85 or 1.31%, at NSE on January 27.

headline: Vedanta to pare stake in Hindustan Zinc, announces offer for sale
condensed_text:
Vedanta Ltd on Tuesday said it has approved the sale of up to 1.59% stake in Hindustan Zinc Ltd through an offer for sale (OFS) route. The proposed stake sale by Vedanta involves up to 6.7 crore equity shares of Hindustan Zinc Ltd, representing 1.59% of the issued and paid-up equity share capital of the company. January 27, 2026 at around 04:15 PM IST, approved the sale of upto 6,70,00,000 equity shares of Hindustan Zinc Limited (“HZL”), representing 1.59% of the issued and paid-up equity share capital of HZL, by way of an offer for sale through the stock exchange mechanism, in accordance with applicable laws and the circulars issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India and the stock exchanges," said Vedanta. In the aluminium segment, the company logged its highest-ever quarterly aluminium production at 620 kilotonnes, up 1% year-on-year, and alumina production at 794 kilotonnes, up 57%
In its Zinc business, the company logged its highest-ever third-quarter mined metal production at 276 kilotonnes, up 4% year-on-year, and refined metal production at 270 kilotonnes, also up 4%. Shares of  Vedanta closed  3.19% higher at Rs 705.65 and Hindustan Zinc stock ended  4% higher at Rs 726.60 on BSE today.
