headline: Rekha Jhunjhunwala earns₹858 crore from Titan after India-US trade deal
condensed_text: In just two days, one of Rekha Jhunjhunwala's portfolio stocks, Titan Company shares, have surged from ₹ 3,953.20 to ₹ 4,135.10 apiece on the NSE, logging a gain of ₹ 181.90 in the two sessions. Interestingly, LIC also owns 2,23,24,301 Titan Company shares, and the insurance behemoth of India has earned around ₹ 406 crore from the rally in this jewellery stock after the announcement of the India-US trade deal. After the announcement of the India-US trade deal, which is expected to benefit gems and jewellery stocks, Titan's share price skyrocketed from ₹ 3953.20 per share on the NSE to ₹ 4135.10, logging a net rise of ₹ 181.90 per share. As Rekha Jhunjhunwala owns 4,71,84,470 Titan Company shares, the total rise in Rekha Jhunjhunwala's net worth due to the rise in Tata Company shares is ₹ 8,58,28,55,093 or around ₹ 858 crore ( ₹ 181.90 x 4,71,84,470). As the Titan share price rose by ₹ 181.90 per share, the net rise in LIC's portfolio due to this Tata Group's jewellery stock is ₹ 406 crore ( ₹ 181.90 x 2,23,24,301).

headline: City Union Bank targets mid-teen loan growth, stays cautious on unsecured lending
condensed_text: N Kamakodi, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of City Union Bank, says the bank is positioning itself for sustained mid-to-high teen loan growth over the coming quarters, led by secured lending across micro, small and medium enterprises , gold loans, agriculture and secured retail, while remaining cautious on unsecured expansion as it prioritises balance-sheet stability.The forward momentum is supported by a strong operating performance in the October-December quarter of 2025 , with net interest income rising 28% year-on-year to ₹752 crore, pre-provision operating profit up 17.7% at ₹513 crore and profit after tax  growing 16.1% to ₹332 crore.The bank’s market capitalisation stands at about ₹21,643.30 crore, and its shares have gained close to 66% over the past one year.Below are the edited excerpts from the interview.Q: You have given the street a guidance of growing in the mid to high teens, 15% to 20%, kind of growth. And specifically, in unsecured, how much headroom do you have, given some of the asset quality pressures that lenders have been telling us seem to have abated?A: We have always concentrated more on the secured front, starting with the MSMEs, commercial trading, and we added secured retail, particularly housing loans, loan against the property , rental discounting and all.So, from 2024 onwards, we have started building up the team, and around the end of the calendar year , we were able to see growth improving. And we have not gone in a significant way, unsecured retail, so far, and that strategy will stay for many more quarters to come before, if at all, we see on that line.Also Read: Budget 2026 | PSU bank mergers, capital rule changes on the table as India aims for bigger global banks: DFS SecretaryBut as of now, we are going purely on secured lending on MSMEs, commercial trading, gold loans and agriculture, along with now the secured retail of, let’s say, housing loans, LAP and other things.So, we feel we are spending some time on setting up the team. So, could you give us a sense of margins, based on all these factors?A: As you rightly said, we started fixed-rate gold loans a year before last, and the entire gold loan portfolio has, by and large, converted into a fixed-rate portfolio already. As we discussed in the con-call, over the next two to three quarters, whatever term deposits are maturing and repricing at lower rates, we will get the benefit to compensate for whatever yield reduction is happening on the asset side because of the repo cut.So overall, we are confident that whatever margin we currently have is sustainable, with a plus or minus 10 basis points.Q: The credit-deposit  ratio is at 86%, are you comfortable with that and your guidance for what kind of deposit growth would you have?A: The deposit growth will definitely be in tune with the credit growth, so that there will not be any stoppage in credit because of the non-availability of deposits.

headline: Global Health Q3 Results: Net profit falls 33% on margin compression
condensed_text: Global Health Ltd, which operates hospitals under the Medanta brand, on Wednesday  reported a 33.6% year-on-year decline in net profit to ₹95 crore for the third quarter, compared with ₹143 crore in the same period last year.Revenue rose 18.8% year-on-year to ₹1,121 crore from ₹943.3 crore. EBITDA margin stood at 19.4% in the quarter, compared with 25.2% in the corresponding period last year.Global Health's board has approved the appointment of Malik Mohd. Ashhab as Senior Management Personnel of the company, designated as Head–Diagnostic Services.Also Read: Budget 2026: Global Health, Aster DM rise up to 5% post FM's medical tourism pushThe board also recommended certain proposals to shareholders for their consideration and approval. These include the re-appointment of Dr Ravi Gupta as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years with effect from July 8, 2026.In addition, the Board recommended the re-appointment of Rajan Bharti Mittal as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years with effect from July 8, 2026. The Board further recommended the appointment of Shonan Purie Trehan as a Non-Executive Non-Independent Director of the company, liable to retire by rotation, with effect from March 13, 2026.Shares of Global Health Ltd ended at ₹1,127.00, up by ₹13.00, or 1.17%, on the BSE.Also Read: Global Health Q2 profit up 21% YoY; to expand Mumbai hospital to 750 beds

headline: Mahindra Lifespace lines up ₹8,000 crore launches to power FY27 pre-sales
condensed_text: Mahindra Lifespace Developers, the real estate and infrastructure development arm of the Mahindra Group, plans to launch multiple residential projects over the next few months as it targets higher pre-sales in the next financial year 2026-27 , according to Managing Director and CEO Amit Kumar Sinha.Sinha said the company is preparing two to three major launches in the next three months. Sinha said, “We’ve given guidance of ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore for our pre-sales.”The company reported its earnings for the October–December 2025 quarter, supported by a recovery in residential sales and demand in its industrial and integrated cities business.Mahindra Lifespace currently has a market capitalisation of ₹7,970.49 crore. So, one of them is Mahindra Blossom.Also Read | Hyundai Motor India plans to lift exports share to 30% of production by FY30We are expecting a couple of other launches to come through, but more importantly, for the launches that we did in the early part of the year, as well as the phase launches of the previous projects, which will give us growth momentum. We are pushing hard to get them sooner, but this is very important, because for the next year, I've given guidance of ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore for our pre-sales on the residential side, and that's something that we are looking forward to by having these launches lined up in the early part of the next financial year. So, it hasn't been a very significant shift on the inventory overhang side, but there are certain pockets and segments where you see a slowdown.Also Read | Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radarThe second is that we need to be clear where we play, and it's good that we are present in Mumbai, Pune and Bengaluru.The third part is, as things slow down — and we expect some part of it to happen and then get corrected over a longer period — there is a shift towards branded developers, and quality developers who have a multi-year track record, who have always met customer expectations, and delivered projects on time in line with expectations.

headline: Trent Q3 net profit rises 36% to Rs 640 crore, revenue up 16%
condensed_text:
Trent Q3 net profit rises 36% to Rs 640 crore, revenue up 16%. My Account
Follow us on:

headline: Trent Q3 Results: Operating profit growth beats estimates, margin expands
condensed_text: Tata Group retail firm Trent Ltd on Wednesday  reported a 2.7% year-on-year rise in net profit for Q3 at ₹510 crore, compared with ₹496.5 crore in the same period last year, slightly below CNBC-TV18’s poll estimate of ₹537 crore.Revenue grew 14.8% to ₹5,345 crore from ₹4,656 crore a year ago. EBITDA margin improved to 20.2% from 18.2% in Q3 last year.Trent now operates a significant portfolio of over 1,100 “large-box” fashion stores, with a presence across 274 cities. In Q3FY26, the company opened 17 Westside and 48 Zudio stores, including one store in the UAE.As of December 31, 2025, the store portfolio comprised 278 Westside stores, 854 Zudio stores , and 32 stores across other lifestyle concepts. The gross margin profile of Westside and Zudio remained stable, while the operating EBIT margin for Q3FY26 was 13.8%, up from 13.2% in Q3FY25.Trent’s Star business consisted of 79 stores during the nine months ended December 31, 2025, including the addition of six stores and the closure of five. The company is implementing multiple interventions, including technology upgrades, aimed at enhancing differentiation and improving convenience for its customers.Shares of Trent ended 5.2% higher on Wednesday, ahead of the earnings announcement at ₹4,021.

headline: Anthropic-led AI volatility an opportunity for IT services, says Happiest Minds’ Ashok Soota
condensed_text: Recent global rout in IT stocks, triggered by fears that advanced artificial intelligence tools could disrupt traditional services models, should be viewed as an opportunity rather than a threat, said Ashok Soota, Chairman and Chief Mentor of Happiest Minds Technologies. A veteran of India’s IT industry, Soota previously founded Mindtree and earlier played a key role in scaling Wipro’s IT services business. He added, in a statement, that the growing excitement around AI platforms and plug-ins may lower the entry barrier for building software, but it does not diminish the role of IT services firms. “As an AI First company, we welcome this development,” Soota said in a statement, adding that innovations in enterprise AI reinforce the role of IT services in guiding organisations through large-scale technology transformation. While AI platforms act as accelerators, he said, real value is created only when these tools are embedded into core business processes and aligned with security, compliance and industry regulations.

headline: Welspun Enterprises Q3 profit tumbles 66% as sales dip, cost control lifts margins
condensed_text: Welspun Enterprises Ltd reported a sharp decline in profitability for the third quarter, with consolidated net profit falling 65.6% year-on-year to ₹26.7 crore, compared with ₹77.5 crore in the same quarter last year.Revenue for the quarter declined 12.2% year-on-year to ₹787 crore from ₹896 crore. EBITDA margin expanded to 19.6% during the quarter, compared with 17.6% in the corresponding period last year.The Q3 performance reflects pressure on topline and profitability on a year-on-year basis, even as margins improved, indicating better cost control relative to revenue during the period.Q2 performance snapshotIn contrast to the Q3 outcome, Welspun Corp Ltd had delivered a strong performance in the second quarter. The company reported a 53.2% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to ₹439 crore, compared with ₹287 crore in the same period last year.Revenue in Q2 rose 32.5% year-on-year to ₹4,373 crore from ₹3,301.8 crore. EBITDA margin for the quarter stood at 13.5%, up from 12.1% in the corresponding period last year.During the quarter, Welspun Corp announced the acquisition of 2.72 crore equity shares, representing a 4.11% stake in Welspun Specialty Solutions Ltd, from the promoter group at market price, subject to regulatory approvals. Upon completion, its equity holding in the subsidiary will rise from 51.06% to 55.17%.The company also announced plans to incorporate a wholly owned subsidiary in the Dubai International Financial Centre, UAE, to act as an investment holding company for global investments, subject to necessary approvals.Also read: Welspun Corp Q2 net profit jumps 53% to ₹439 crore, revenue surges 33%Shares of Welspun Enterprises Limited ended 0.60% higher on the NSE at ₹471.05 on 04 February 2026.

headline: Trent Q3 results: Net profit rises to Rs 510 crore; revenue jumps 15% to Rs 5,345 crore
condensed_text: Trent Ltd , the retail arm of the Tata Group, on Wednesday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 510.11 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 496.54 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal, a growth of roughly 3 per cent year-on-year. The company’s revenue from operations witnessed a double-digit rise, at Rs 5,345.06 crore, a 15 per cent jump compared to Rs 4,656.56 crore recorded in the same period last year. "The customer sentiment is gradually improving and our business outlook for the medium term continues to remain positive," said Noel N Tata, Chairman, Trent. As of December 31, 2025, the company’s store portfolio included 278 Westside stores and 854 Zudio stores, including a growing presence in the UAE.
